This question pertains to the relationship between the position of a light source and the resulting shadow of an object. As a source of light moves directly overhead of an object, the size of the shadow will plummet. 

The reason for this is that when the light source is directly overhead, the object's shadow will be at its smallest. This is because the light rays are coming from directly above and are casting the object's shadow directly beneath it. As the light source moves away from being directly overhead, the angle between the light rays and the object increases, resulting in a larger shadow.

Option (A) is incorrect because the size of the shadow will not increase as the light source moves directly overhead. Option (C) is redundant and provides similar information to option (A). Option (D) is also incorrect because "grow" and "increase" are essentially synonymous in this context. Therefore, the correct answer is option (B), which accurately describes the decrease in size of the shadow.

This question is asking about the relationship between the position of a light source and the size of a shadow. As a light source moves directly overhead of an object, the size of the shadow will decrease or "plummet". This is because when the light source is directly overhead, the object blocks less of the light, resulting in a smaller shadow. Option (A) is incorrect because the size of the shadow decreases, not increases. Option (C) and (D) are synonyms for increase and are also incorrect.

When a light source moves directly overhead of an object, the size of the shadow will decrease, not increase. This is because when the light source is directly overhead, the object blocks less light, resulting in a smaller shadow. Option (A) is incorrect because the size of the shadow decreases. Option (C) and (D) are synonyms and do not accurately describe the change in the size of the shadow.

Option (B) is the correct answer because "plummet" means to suddenly decrease or fall rapidly, which is what happens to the size of the shadow in this scenario.
